results.title: Focus on Ethiopia
results.brief_description: A survey of the growth of Ethiopia since the war. Scenes are given of new building, educational and agricultural programs which are now under way. The recent history of the country is traced from the beginning of the 20th century, including newsreel sequences of the Italo-Ethiopian war. Under the leadership of Emperor Haile Selassie the country is being prepared to take an important place in world affairs.

results.title: Focus on downers
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: Vignettes illustrate how barbiturates can lead to death when they cause the user to forget how many they have taken, when they are taken with alcohol or when the user attempts to drive. Questions use by young people, and discusses barbiturate withdrawal.

results.title: Flying: a dream come true
results.brief_description: Shows gliding enthusiasts building their planes, their training and techniques. The Wasser-Kuppe Hill in the Rhoen mountains is a popular resort for gliders. The weightless flight, an old dream of man’s has persisted in spite of the innovation of the motor driven aircraft.

results.title: Flutter and its prevention
results.brief_description: The significance of “flutter” in aerodynamics and its drastic results, ie aeroplane crash. Ways to prevent flutter and therefore avoid aircraft accidents and loss of life and valuable property.

results.title: Flute, clarinet and bassoon
results.brief_description: Introduces three of the woodwind instruments and illustrates the principle by which each produces a musical sound. How a scale is produced by the opening and closing of holes is demonstrated through diagrams and close-ups of each instrument. The instruments are played separately, in pairs and as a trio.

results.title: Flipper the seal
results.brief_description: One of a series of films produced as a background for reading and expression. Following a visit to a zoo, one of the young visitors decides to learn more about seals. While he reads such words as “waves”, “swimming”, “dive” and “fur”, seals are shown in their natural surroundings swimming, playing and caring for their young. Other activities, such as clay modelling and writing a story about seals, are suggested as a class project.

results.title: Flight
results.creator_credit: Josef Reeve, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film about the sport of gliding, which creates the feeling of what it is like to soar as silently and effortlessly as a gull. This is a captivating journey into nearer space, where all the beauty of earth and heaven seems to meet at the wide-winged engineless craft poised between them. It will appeal to the adventuresome, but every audience will enjoy these unusual views of Canada’s Laurentians and Rockies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Josef Reeve, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Five, four, three, two, one birds away
results.brief_description: In a simulated attack by a Jindivik unmanned target aircraft, the destroyer H.M.A.S. Hobart demonstrates its new electronic detection and defence systems, firing a Tarter guided missile. Part of the Navy in Focus series.

results.title: The Five
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated health education film for school children designed to create a positive attitude in the minds of young girls aged 8-12 years. it seeks to encourage them to look after their feet, and emphasises the importance of wearing correctly fitted shoes. Animated by Harold Whitaker.
